source:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified.

 - input  clk
 - input  enable
 - input  S
 - input  A
 - input  B
 - input  C

content:
```
Implement an 8-bit shift register using D-type flip-flops. The shift register should have an input S and outputs Q[0] to Q[7]. The enable input is synchronous active high and controls whether to shift.

Retrieved Related Information:
- enable: Synchronous active high control signal for shifting.
- S: Input signal for the shift register.
- Q[0]: Output of the first flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[1]: Output of the second flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[2]: Output of the third flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[3]: Output of the fourth flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[4]: Output of the fifth flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[5]: Output of the sixth flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[6]: Output of the seventh flip-flop in the shift register.
- Q[7]: Output of the eighth flip-flop in the shift register.
```
source: First, create an 8-bit shift register with 8 D-type flip-flops. Label the flip-flop outputs from Q[0]...Q[7]. The shift register input should be called S, which feeds the input of Q[0] (MSB is shifted in first). The enable input is synchronous active high and controls whether to shift.

content:
```
Implement a multiplexer that selects one of the Q[0] to Q[7] outputs based on the inputs A, B, and C. The output Z should be assigned the value of the selected Q output.

Retrieved Related Information:
- B: Input signal for selecting output Z (Type:Signal)
- C: Input signal for selecting output Z (Type:Signal)
- Z: Output signal determined by the combination of inputs A, B, and C (Type:Signal)
- When ABC is 000, Z=Q[0] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 001, Z=Q[1] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 010, Z=Q[2] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 011, Z=Q[3] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 100, Z=Q[4] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 101, Z=Q[5] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 110, Z=Q[6] (Type:StateTransition)
- When ABC is 111, Z=Q[7] (Type:StateTransition)
```
source: Extend the circuit to have 3 additional inputs A,B,C and an output Z. The circuit's behaviour should be as follows: when ABC is 000, Z=Q[0], when ABC is 001, Z=Q[1], and so on.
